name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.retry-delay.max.ms
description:
The maximum number of ms the reducer will delay before retrying
  to download map data.

name: fs.trash.checkpoint.interval
description:
Number of minutes between trash checkpoints.
  Should be smaller or equal to fs.trash.interval. If zero,
  the value is set to the value of fs.trash.interval.
  Every time the checkpointer runs it creates a new checkpoint
  out of current and removes checkpoints created more than
  fs.trash.interval minutes ago.

name: dfs.client.cached.conn.retry
description:
The number of times the HDFS client will pull a socket from the
   cache.  Once this number is exceeded, the client will try to create a new
   socket.

name: dfs.client.deadnode.detection.probe.suspectnode.threads
description: The maximum number of threads to use for probing suspect node.

name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.connection.retries
description: FC connection retries for graceful fencing

name: dfs.client.block.write.retries
description:
The number of retries for writing blocks to the data nodes, 
  before we signal failure to the application.

name: dfs.client.deadnode.detection.probe.suspectnode.interval.ms
description: Interval time in milliseconds for probing suspect node behavior.

name: mapreduce.reduce.shuffle.fetch.retry.timeout-ms
description:
Timeout value for fetcher to retry to fetch again when some
  non-fatal failure happens because of some events like NM restart.

name: ipc.[port_number].weighted-cost.response
description:
The weight multiplier to apply to the time spent in the
    RESPONSE phase which do not involve holding a lock.
    See org.apache.hadoop.ipc.ProcessingDetails.Timing for more details on
    this phase. This property applies to WeightedTimeCostProvider.
